    • Class it.polimi.ingsw.gc12.Commands.ClientCommands.GameTransitionCommand

      class GameTransitionCommand extends Object implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • CURRENT_PLAYER_INDEX
          int CURRENT_PLAYER_INDEX
          Index of the current player in the game's list of players. Values [0, MAX_PLAYERS): Index of a specific player based on the number of players in a game. Value -1 is used as a placeholder indicating that the following game phase has to be played by everybody.
        • ROUND
          int ROUND
          The current round number in the game.
        • TURNS_LEFT_UNTIL_GAME_ENDS
          int TURNS_LEFT_UNTIL_GAME_ENDS
          Number of turns (Play phase + Draw phase) until the game ends. Values [0, 2 * MAX_PLAYERS): Number of turns until the game ends. Value -1 indicates that the game is not in the final phase.

  • Package it.polimi.ingsw.gc12.Model.ClientModel

    • Class it.polimi.ingsw.gc12.Model.ClientModel.ClientCard

      class ClientCard extends Object implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • GUI_SPRITES
          Map<Side,String> GUI_SPRITES
          A map of the card's image resources path, keyed by side. This is used for the graphical display of the card in the user interface.
        • ID
          int ID
          A unique card identifier to facilitate the card's retrieval.
        • TUI_SPRITES
          Map<Side,ArrayList<ArrayList<Triplet<String,Integer[],Integer>>>> TUI_SPRITES
          A map representing the card's appearance in the TUI (Text User Interface) view. Each card side is visualized through two entries, each corresponding to one side of the card. The external list represents the rows of the card (in this project, each card has 5 rows). Each row contains a list of triplets, where each triplet represents a visual segment of the row.

          The triplet consists of: - A string: typically a character (either a space or a printable character). - An array of integers: representing the foreground and background color codes. - An integer: indicating the length for which this visual pattern should be repeated.

          For example, if a row in a card consists entirely of the same character and color, the length will reflect the number of characters to be displayed on the screen.

    • Class it.polimi.ingsw.gc12.Model.ClientModel.ClientGame

      class ClientGame extends Room implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • CHAT_LOG
          List<String> CHAT_LOG
          The log of all chat messages received during the game.
        • COMMON_OBJECTIVES
          ClientCard[] COMMON_OBJECTIVES
          The two objective cards visible to all the players placed on the table.
        • currentPlayerIndex
          int currentPlayerIndex
          The index of the player currently playing. A value of -1 means that it is a setup phase and each player has to perform an action
        • currentRound
          int currentRound
          The current turn's number
        • MYSELF
          ClientPlayer MYSELF
          The player associated to this client
        • OWN_HAND
          ArrayList<ClientCard> OWN_HAND
          The cards in this player's hand
        • ownObjective
          ClientCard ownObjective
          The secret Objective Card chosen by this player
        • PLACED_GOLD_CARDS
          ClientCard[] PLACED_GOLD_CARDS
          The two gold cards visible to all the players placed on the table.
        • PLACED_RESOURCE_CARDS
          ClientCard[] PLACED_RESOURCE_CARDS
          The two resource cards visible to all the players placed on the table.
        • topDeckGoldCard
          ClientCard topDeckGoldCard
          The card on top of the gold deck
        • topDeckResourceCard
          ClientCard topDeckResourceCard
          The card on top of the resource deck
        • turnsLeftUntilGameEnds
          int turnsLeftUntilGameEnds
          The number of turns after which the game will end. A value of -1 means that the final phase of the game hasn't started yet.

      class ClientPlayer extends Player implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • isActive

          The resources currently owned by this player.

          The points currently gained by this player.

  • Package it.polimi.ingsw.gc12.Model.Server

    • Class it.polimi.ingsw.gc12.Model.Server.Game

      class Game extends Room implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • COMMON_OBJECTIVES
          ObjectiveCard[] COMMON_OBJECTIVES
          The two objective cards visible to all the players placed on the table.
        • currentPlayer
          int currentPlayer
          The index which points to the player which is playing right now (-1 when the game is in the setup phase)
        • currentRound
          int currentRound
          The current turn's number, which is handled by the GameState.
        • finalPhaseCounter
          int finalPhaseCounter
          The number of remaining turns before the game ends (-1 when the game is not in in final phase)
        • GAME_LISTENERS
          CopyOnWriteArrayList<Listener> GAME_LISTENERS
          The list containing all the listeners subscribed to this instance of game.
        • GOLD_CARDS_DECK
          CardDeck<GoldCard> GOLD_CARDS_DECK
          The deck of Gold cards of this game.
        • OBJECTIVE_CARDS_DECK
          CardDeck<ObjectiveCard> OBJECTIVE_CARDS_DECK
          The deck of Objective cards of this game.
        • PLACED_GOLD_CARDS
          GoldCard[] PLACED_GOLD_CARDS
          The two gold cards visible to all the players placed on the table.
        • PLACED_RESOURCE_CARDS
          ResourceCard[] PLACED_RESOURCE_CARDS
          The two resource cards visible to all the players placed on the table.
        • RESOURCE_CARDS_DECK
          CardDeck<ResourceCard> RESOURCE_CARDS_DECK
          The deck of Resource cards of this game.

      class SocketHandler extends NetworkSession implements Serializable

      • Serialization Methods

        • writeObject
          public void writeObject(Object obj) throws IOException
          Writes an object to the output stream.
          Parameters:
          obj - The object to be sent over the network.
          Throws:
          IOException - if an I/O error occurs while writing the object.

      • Serialized Fields

        • objectInputStream
          ObjectInputStream objectInputStream
          The input stream for receiving objects.
        • objectOutputStream
          ObjectOutputStream objectOutputStream
          The output stream for sending objects.
        • socket
          Socket socket
          The socket used for communication with the other actor.
        • writeQueue
          LinkedBlockingQueue<Command> writeQueue
          The queue for outgoing commands to be written.
